issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Android: Accessibility : LVH values are not read on button clicks.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run Acceptance Access_1101 on  Accessibility module.
2. Touch the first button (with LVH defined in sequence) 

Expected:
2. The device reads aloud:
"Button1"
"Value1"
"Hint1"
followed by "Button" 

Actual:
Device reads out just "Clicked"
fields.summary: Android: Accessibility : LVH values are not read on button clicks
fields.environment:
Android Version : 4.0.4
SDK: 3.1.0.v20130327135307
CLI version : 3.0.25-alpha
OS : MAC OSX 10.8.2

comments.body:
Issue still occurs for HTC Desire V (v4.0.3), but works fine on Galaxy Nexus 4.1.1 using :
OS: Mountain Lion 10.8
Appcelerator Studio: 3.2.1.201401241158
SDK: 3.2.1.v20140128171647
Xcode: 5.0
acs:1.0.12
alloy:1.3.1-beta4
jake:0.7.6
npm:1.3.2
node: 0.10.13
titanium:3.2.1-beta3
titanium-code-processor:1.1.0
Closing ticket due to time passed and lack of progress for a number of years. Please open a new ticket if there are any problems.
